modules.title: Introduction to Linux Terminal
modules.description: An introduction to the Linux Terminal, its importance, and basic navigation commands.
points: Opening the terminal and basic commands

modules.title: File System Navigation
modules.description: Learn how to navigate the Linux file system using commands like ls, cd, and pwd.

modules.title: File and Directory Management
modules.description: Covers creating, moving, copying, and deleting files and directories in the Linux Terminal.

modules.title: File Permissions
modules.description: Explains Linux file permissions, how to read them, and how to modify them using chmod and chown.
points: Changing permissions with chmod and chown

modules.title: Working with Text Files
modules.description: Introduces commands for viewing, editing, and manipulating text files in the Linux Terminal.
points: Viewing files with cat, less, and more
Editing files with nano and vim

modules.title: Pipes and Redirection
modules.description: Learn how to use pipes and redirection to combine commands and manage input/output in the Linux Terminal.

modules.title: Process Management
modules.description: Explains how to monitor and manage processes in the Linux Terminal using commands like ps, top, and kill.
points: Viewing processes with ps and top

modules.title: Package Management
modules.description: Covers installing, updating, and removing software packages using package managers like apt and yum.
points: Using yum or dnf for Red Hat-based systems

modules.title: Shell Scripting Basics
modules.description: Introduces shell scripting to automate tasks in the Linux Terminal using bash scripts.
points: Creating and running a bash script

modules.title: Networking Commands
modules.description: Learn essential networking commands for troubleshooting and managing network connections in Linux.
points: Viewing network interfaces with ifconfig or ip
Downloading files with wget and curl

questions.question: Which command is used to list files in a directory?
What command changes the current directory to the parent directory?
Which command is used to remove a file?
